intro: Odontocarya mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican toothbrush plant, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and hairy stems. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often covered with fine pubescence. Odontocarya mexicana is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
